contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = West MacDonnell National Park | iucn_category = II | image = Australia_Locator_Map.svg | caption = | locator_x = 143 | locator_y = 95 | nearest_town_or_city = [[Alice Springs, Northern Territory|Alice Springs]] | coordinates = {{coord|23|26|11|S|132|25|05|E|type:landmark_region:AU}} | area = 2,069 kmÂ² | established = 1992 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = Parks and Wildlife Commission of the Northern Territory | official_site = [http://www.nt.gov.au/nreta/parks/find/westmacdonnell.html West MacDonnell National Park] }} [[Image:West MacDonnell National Park.JPG|thumb|left|View along the West MacDonnell Ranges from the Larapinta Trail, near Glen Helen]] '''West MacDonnell''' is a national park in the [[Northern Territory]] ([[Australia]]), 1234 km south of [[Darwin, Northern Territory|Darwin]]. It extends along the [[MacDonnell Ranges]] west of [[Alice Springs, Northern Territory|Alice Springs]]. The popular extended walk, the [[Larapinta Trail]], runs east-west along the linear park, following the [[West MacDonnell Ranges]]. The park includes many tourist attractions along its 250 kilometre length including [[Ormiston Pound]], the [[Ellery Creek Bighole]], Glen Helen, [[Simpsons Gap]], Standley Chasm, [[Mount Sonder]], Serpentine Gorge, the [[Ochre Pits]] and Redbank Gorge. ==References== *''West MacDonnell National Park Fact Sheet'', Parks and Wildlife Commission of NT. *''West MacDonnell National Park'',Northern Territory Government: Department of Natural Resources,Environment,The Arts and Sport [http://www.nt.gov.au/nreta/parks/find/westmacdonnell.html]. == See also == * [[Protected areas of the Northern Territory (Australia)]] {{National Parks of the Northern Territory}} [[Category:National parks of the Northern Territory]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1992]] {{NorthernTerritory-geo-stub}} {{Australia-protected-area-stub}}
